column4: hi. can someone tell me why my 11.10 system looks like a 90's installation of redhat?
the theme looks very old all of a sudden
be a bit more specific. perhaps post a screen shot - and tell us the version # of ububntu you are using.

I am using 11.10, had this computer as is for 2 years and been upgrading normally since v8. I don't know why I am having trouble dealing with unity and I just don't like it. I would rather be using gnome. But it seems like gnome 2 is just not cutting it with the recent changes
gnome -2 is dead....   If you want a old-skool type desktop these days. You may want to check out Lubuntu/Lxde

I don't want an oldskool looking anything. In fact, I hate the currently looking system. It looks like I reverted back to a very old one. I am guessing my themes are not compatible with the 11.10 changes
gnome-3 uses totally differnt themeing then the old gnome. theres also gtk2 vs gtk3 issues.
there was a bug  that caused gnome2 to reset back to a window-95ish theme.. if thats what you are refering to.

I think I might have some gnome2 apps along with other gnome3 apps. Gnome shell fails to launch properly, either I get a segfault or it just hangs without me being able to focus on any running window, which leaves my x system unstable
sounds like that's it, how do I fix that?
no idea. ive never experienced it.. this is the forst ive heard it mentioned in 11.10 also.. it was a 11.04 bug.
gnome2 is basically removed..  everyone is fighting with  trying to get gnome3/gnome-shell to look/act like gnome2
not me. I am actually trying to get gnome3 to work
clean install here.. gnome-shell works fine. testing out themes for it now.
as a test.. try making a new user.. see if gnome-shell works for them. it could be your old user settings are causing the issues.
as a test.. try making a new user.. see if gnome-shell works for them. it could be your old user settings are causing the issues.
negative, I deleted all config files and still having issues
does it say why its fscking. any messages like 'last fsck date set to future' or 'fsck count reashed'

the netbooks cmos battery is not working properly anymore. So I have to set the time/date on each startup. It used to be a problem like you mentioned, that the last mount is in the future. Until I would just set the time every on every boot
